title: Excellent service
body: This practice is amazing. All the staff that I have come into contact with go the extra mile. They are efficient and thorough & very approachable. They listen & work with the patient providing excellent care. I cannot recommend them highly enough. They‚Äôre doing a great job in difficult times

title: Brilliant with nervous patients (like me)
body: Had a small procedure to remove a cyst from my lower eyelid, from the booking in right through to giving me all the time I needed after being a light headed after the op to gather myself before leaving, all the staff I encountered were professional, kind & helpful. A big thank you to you all, keep up the good work.

title: Amazing staff
body: The Liver outpatients are just amazing.  Caring, kind,organised. I feel everyone in the teamwork so very hard to reassure me.  PBC is a weird one but I feel cared for and well looked after.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Endoscopy Department - Wonderful Staff and Service
body: I visited queens hospital today. I had a colonoscopy procedure. All of the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. The wards and rooms were pristine, all in all it was a fabulous service. Would recommend and grateful for being looked after as I was.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: All you need for your day to day medical needs
body:
A wonderfully friendly practice that deals with its patients with care and professionalism. My family have attended this practice with a wide range of ailments from ill mental health to saving my baby‚Äôs life. The staff here endeavour to see you as an individual and actually take the time to listen to your concerns. Having a dispensary on site is a fabulous asset to the practice. The dispensary team are quick and smiley. In fact all of the staff are wonderful, kind and caring. They‚Äôve dealt with the most difficult of times through covid and not one of them has ever faltered in their positive manner to their work. A privilege to be so lucky to have this surgery virtually on my doorstep. 
A great team, a great practice.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Cannot fault Lime Tree & Sinnott Road surgery. Every person I‚Äôve dealt with, from receptionist to nurses to GPs has been kind, courteous and professional. The care my son and I have both received has been excellent, and I have always been listened to and seen face-to-face when I feel we‚Äôve needed it. It‚Äôs clearly an incredibly challenging time for GPs at the moment, but you would never know through interactions with the staff here. Just excellent, thank you for everything.

title: Amazing service
body: Attended for a deep knife cut to hand. Despite necessary Covid restrictions the staff were working so hard to get through the large number of patients.

title: Fantastic
body: I did an econsult late on a Friday, hoping to hear something back on Monday. All sorted before 6pm on Friday with the prescription ready to be collected. Just wonderful.

author: deltamf65
title: Excellent GP service
body: Thank you to Dr Shirt at Pitsmoor surgery who phoned me promptly and gave me helpful and reassuring advice today regarding my child.

title: Great Treatment
body: I attended the eye clinic on Fri 18th March. I found the staff very helpful and received very good treatment from the whole department from entering it till I left after my appointment.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Practical advice for medication
body:
Excellent personnel skills and advice how to use medication which never been given before by HP or chemist

Well done

title: Absolutely amazing ward
body: Nightingale is one of the best wards doctors and nurses and carers are amazing üëè thank you for making my husbands stay comfortable and with dignity. Wonderful caring

title: Urgent in the title does not refer to short wait!
body:
My doctor sent me there for an urgent blood test. She did not warn me of the 90 minute outside wait in cold, windy weather.
The main waiting room was empty but not in use for blood test waiting. The inside blood test waiting area held about ten waiting. Felt sorry for the dozen or so waiting in the cold queue outside who did not make the 12.00 deadline and were refused a test.

title: What a great service
body:
I found a breast lump and phoned the GP who saw me the same day. I was referred to the Breast Clinic at the RBH who phoned me in 3 working days and gave me an appointment 2 days later. 
I had a consultation, a mammogram, an ultrasound and a meeting with the doctor who assured me the results were clear and I was out of there in just over an hour!
What an amazing service. I was anxious but their calm professional attitude made a difficult day much easier. I think the RBH Breast Clinic are brilliant, thank you.

title: Medication request
body: I have requested medication, which for some reason is not on my repeat but I have often, and failed to get it. I need this medication because otherwise I'm awake all night. Trying to get through to the surgery is impossible.  After I've listened to the message on the phone for 1 and half minutes I'm then in a queue.  Often at the back of the queue and then cut off after 30 minutes. All I want is some medication , why is it so difficult when I've requested it on the medication page in the notes section.  Obviously they are not reading them.  Utter waste of time and I feel people are really being neglected by this practice. It takes a review for them to notice you.

title: disgusting treatment
body: i have been feeling very poorly and in alot of pain i saw a doctor and started a coarse of antibiotics and she said she would speak with another doctor that knew more about my case . a couple of days later i felt worse i rang up and could only get a phone call from blackrod surgery she said i needed to be seen at peterhouse and gave me an appointment .i saw the doctor and was assured i had been reffered to hospital. after waiting for postman on the friday and got no letter i rang hospital and was told i had not been reffered . i was on the phone 2 hours trying to speak to some one . i decided to go to surgery and was told i had not been referred.i could not speak to anyone and the receptionist had a very bad attitude towards me  not very nice for an 80 year old person in pain. i rang the surgery about 5pm and spoke to a lovely lady that did her best for me .  i was stunned and could not believe it when i got a letter saturday morning to book an appointment myself so i cant do it until monday. a long long time to be in pain and feeling very poorly , i hope i survive

title: Forgotten
body: Rang 111 at 7:30pm was told i needed an urgent call back within 2 hours. 4 hours later i was struggling to stay awake due to being poorly with Covid so went to sleep leaving my phone on loud. Woke up with morning 7:30am no call back or voicemail left.

title: 111 - waste of time
body: I called 111 at 5pm due my 1 year old having multiple blisters in her mouth (suspected HFM) she hadn‚Äôt eaten or drank barely anything in 5 days and was screaming in pain. Was told she needed to be seen within 2 hours and a local OOH doctor would call us to arrange this. I was called after 2 hours to make me aware they were extremely busy and that I would be getting a call but it might be a bit longer. It‚Äôs now 8am and I have still had no call. This is absolutely disgusting and makes the whole 111 process seem completely pointless. Had I known this was going to be the case I would have take her straight to a&e and not let her have another sleepless night screaming in pain.

title: Buzzer
body:
Buzzer still not working! Last time I visited a very polite and helpful 
receptionist told me to knock on the window for admission.
On a recent visit, a very officious and unpleasant receptionist told me
to not bang on the window but to call a telephone number. Does
everyone have a mobile phone?

title: Shocking
body: Having dialed the number 108 times at 8 am, finally got it to ring (this was 2 weeks ago). Having been told I was 9th in line i hung on. Finally got an answer and told the receptionist i had an eye infection in both eyes and such a bad cough it had given me a sore throat. I was dismissed immediately from attending the surgery as i had covid symptoms. I assured her i had not and told her i had done 2 tests and both were negative. She was rude and dismissed me. I was in tears as my eyes were really bad and the infection was going down into my face. She said someone would call me later which they did and i was given the appropriate medication later. I was upset by the rudeness and have now left this practice as i find it impossible to make an appointment due to getting past rude receptionists

title: Unbelievably awful
body:
They kept me waiting for more than an hour for ambulance.
As my pain was awful i made too many calls again to stand down from the ambulance and go to the hospital by taxi.
I arrived the hospital before 4 am and 7 persons came and asked about my problem and every time I had to explain from zero and at 1 pm they told me that I can leave.
They took my blood pressure and blood and urine test and without any examination said I have to go to the GP and they will find out what the problem is.
This was funny as I've explained many times to each person that I went to the GP and referred me to a physiotherapist and I have to wait a long time with pain.

They think patients have to shout from pain.
If you remain silent and polite they think you feel completely normal.

After all this
I had pain before goin
I have pain after coming
I was kept for at least 8 hours
Not even 1 simple examination
And they said to go to GP to solve the problem

So i have to be in pain as they didn‚Äôt feel responsible about me.

I‚Äôm really sad about my pain and the care they could do. but they didn‚Äôt get me serious.

title: Very efficient
body: I was looked after every step of the way prior during and after the hip replacement surgery.  All the staff were helpful and thoughtful.

title: Left feeling upset. So rude
body:
I took my 8year daughter today to the Minor Injuries unit because she fell last night and hit her head quite bad on our tiled floor which left her a large visible bruise and bump, so after watching her overnight and taking all the right precautions, she woke up this morning complaining of sore neck and shoulders.

I was made to feel like I shouldn‚Äôt have taken her there, and she was rude to my daughter. I actually left there feeling quite stupid.
Absolutely zero people skills.
It really was a horrible experience.

title: Don't get to see an actual Doctor
body: Been feeling poorly lately and yet again I can only see an advanced practitioner. They do understand but I would like to see an actual doctor or just even speak to one. I can't remember the last time I saw a doctor.

title: Wonderful Practice
body: I am extremely fortunate to be a member of this GP practice, I have a long term health condition and I feel that I am thoroughly supported by the GP‚Äôs and practice nurses with managing this. Reception staff have always been extremely kind .

title: Excellent service
body:
I was experiencing a severe shortage of breath I phoned the surgery on Monday and a telephone interview first thing on Tuesday morning.
The doctor I spoke with arranged an appointment for me at 11.40.
I visited the surgery saw the nurse practitioner and was sent straight to Frimley Park Hospital. 
I have no doubt that had it not been for their quick and accurate diagnosis I wouldn't be writing this review

title: N/a
body: I don't have a problem with the hospital itself, however a carer for my client at the hospital I was denied the use of the restaurant which I was told was for the exclusive use of NHS staff. No problem. But the alternatives are Costa and Amigo which don't provide much of a variety. The hospital could do with a Greggs

title: Great Practice
body: This practice is really run well and all the doctors are very caring also the front office are very attentive.

title: Disappointed
body: Clinicians seem to be dealing with online cases, very disappointing as I am an OAP. Used to be a good GP practice but appointments with doctors have to be given permission.

title: Normally treated very well
body: It's regarding the Eye Clinic. Usually everyone is so helpful and pleasant. But when we spoke to doctor re my husbands glaucoma her manner was very abrupt. She basically told me off for not keeping up enough with my husbands eye drops and that's why there was no improvement in his eyes.  I've taken her advice on board but the way she spoke to me was very unfeeling. I am a devoted full time carer struggling to keep up with my husbands dementia which is getting worse. I have anxiety and depression myself and find it really difficult to do everything and remember everything. So I struggle to keep up with the eye drops. But after she spoke I felt demoralised as if I wasn't taking proper care of my husband, which my husband wouldn't agree with. She showed no feeling only spoke to me like I was a school girl. I am 58. Some People have no idea of how much we have to deal with.

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing service
body:
it has been an absolute privilege to have my care at the Queen Elizabeth hospital breast care unit.  Ive had a couple mammograms and ultrasounds in the last month and two biopsies within a couple weeks of each other.  I was very nervous but need not have been.  The doctors took time to address my concerns and discuss the issues in hand.  I was not in any pain with the biopsies  and the nurses were very comforting, gave me contact number for any problems, did my dressings etc. all the staff are very personable.   The environment and cleanliness were superb. The whole process was amazing and i would not expect better service if i were to pay to go to Harley Street.  I am so very grateful to all the staff in the breast care service.
It is a very well led, safe and compassionate centre. I cannot rate highly enough.

title: Amazing service
body:
it has been an absolute privilege to have my care at the Queen Elizabeth hospital breast care unit.  Ive had a couple mammograms and ultrasounds in the last month and two biopsies within a couple weeks of each other.  I was very nervous but need not have been.  The doctors took time to address my concerns and discuss the issues in hand.  I was not in any pain with the biopsies  and the nurses were very comforting, gave me contact number for any problems, did my dressings etc. all the staff are very personable.   The environment and cleanliness were superb. The whole process was amazing and i would not expect better service if i were to pay to go to Harley Street.  I am so very grateful to all the staff in the breast care service.
It is a very well led, safe and compassionate centre. I cannot rate highly enough.

title: Great staff
body: Myself and mother attended the amyloid centre (17/03/2022) We were provided with transport by the hospitals cue service. Just over a 2 hour drive each way, both drivers were just fantastic!! The staff in the amyloid centre too were fantastic! And we then went to the discharge/transport area where a lovely lady made us drinks, the gentleman (dhl) transport was kind to all and offered sandwiches too. They were also very kind to an elderly lady in pain!! A very tired, old hospital but it‚Äôs the staff that are important and each & every person we came in contact with were just amazing. Thank you to all of you, you are amazing xx

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: 2 Little 2 L8 for this Practice
body: My family has been using this practice for many years dating way back to the ‚ÄúGood Old Days‚Äù when doctors knew their patients. Yes th√© past 18 months have difficult we all know. However I tend to think that the reception staff are abusing this excuse a bit to longgggg now. I tried to get an appointment for my mother using the online system, however just as other have experienced all appointments gone by 08:03, I then called the surgery, but once you go through the morale of covid lectures, this was approximately 1 minute all on the day appointments had gone.  I‚Äôm not sure how this can be possible, unless the surgery is not opening up all the slots. We‚Äôve now moved on from this terrible place with terrible staff.

title: Nightmare getting through but amazing GPs
body:
As everyone else has said it is an absolute nightmare trying to get an appointment. You can be on hold for an hour before getting through and usually there are no appointments left. Have been told to try e-consult instead but that is often unavailable because they now say they are limiting to 50 forms per day due to being overwhelmed.
This is a terrible fix to the problem. It doesn't mean that the 51+ patients aren't sick enough to need help. It just means the 50 people who are astute enough & have the time to fill in the form first thing will more likely get dealt with. 
It's just delaying problems and causing longer term issues in the future.
That said once you do get to see a GP they're really good. They just need an appointment system that works!

title: Kind staff
body: 12-year-old with fractured wrist. Kind staff from start to finish, empathetic, gentle, understanding and helpful explaining details of the x-rays to parents  when asked and clear next instructions provided with very useful splint and good clear advice on future plans

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body:
Bridgewater Surgery is the best when it comes to service. From the receptionist to the GP‚Äôs.
Receptionist are very polite and friendly.
Pharmacist always make sure I am updated with my medication.
GP‚Äôs are very nice, knowledgable and respectful and listen carefully. They even rang me on weekends or late after working hours to discuss my care, treatment and medications.
I am lost for words for Bridgewater Surgery! They are remarkable! Thanks to all of you and More power! 
You are simply the best practice.

title: Very helpfull
body: This was a telephone call which proved to be most helpfull with very good advice on a health problem. It gave us the knowledge  to seek medical  help to the relevant  persons who could help me.Without this telephone call it could have led to alot of problems which could have been serious.

title: Near impossible to make an appointment
body: Unable to use on line service as continually closed down early in the morning until the next day. Near impossible to book an appointment or a conversation appointment. Waited 20 plus minutes for call to be answered. Asked to call back 12.30, then 2.30, then 4.30. Or try again on Monday. All this just to try and obtain a conversation appointment, that I was told was the only way I could asked the doctor to complete an X-ray form for my father in law after a fall. Save using A&E and waiting 5 hours plus. Receptionist completely unhelpful.  Refused to ask the doctor to do this.  Got absolutely no where. Notice feed back from previous day was for exactly the same request and the receptionist was most helpful.  Clearly this practice has serious issues.

title: Some kind staff but too busy to respond to‚Ä¶
body:
Admitted to Onslow Ward.  Not  enough staff to respond fully to every patient. Difficult to find staff  to help, call bell not always answered so left wandering the corridors looking for staff to  help. That happened regularly creating frustration and distress for  patients. 
Acts of kindness by some individual staff who went  out of their way to help were greatly appreciated .

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Staff are helpful, compassionate, and kind. Doctors are dedicated, friendly, supportive, and professional. Thank you üôèüèæ

title: Unfair visiting rules
body: Dad was admitted mid December but only one household allowed to visit for 30 mins a day. I have not seen him since December. Many Weeks of no visits at all due to a two week cancellation of all visits when Covid present which drags on another 2 weeks as another person gets Covid. Very unfair for Alzheimer‚Äôs patients as my dad will probably not even remember me now.

title: Attentive and fast service
body: I've been registered with Archway Medical Center since June 2021 and so far I am very pleased with their service. I really like the fact that appointments can be seamlessly booked via Virtually and can be held over the phone or video call - this is very convenient. Every time I've had to book an appointment I've been able to get one very quickly, sometimes the next day, with a relevant practitioner (e.g. Physio). The practitioners I've had contact with were very professional and knowledgeable and were able to handle the issue very well. I'd recommend.

title: Move on with covid
body: I recently attended the orchard medical centre for a routine medical problem. I seen a GP. I had to buzz at the door and asked questions about covid symptoms before entering. I work at 3 GP practices and not one the GP practices are still doing this. They all now have open doors. I feel the orchard medical centre need to move on as well and make their services a little more accessible. We are a vaccinated population who need access to general practice services. They can no longer lock the doors

author: corridortr74
title: High Blood Pressure and Anxiety
body:
I went for a routine blood pressure check in order to order a repeat pill prescription. My BP was high so I was called back 2 more times to have my BP checked and each time it was high so I was referred to the GP for a call.  
I feel my issues relate to stress and anxiety caused by the recent death of my father (to who's funeral I could not attend) and the need to try and deal with his estate remotely , being amidst changing jobs and my mother having taken ill and needing to be placed in a nursing home whilst suffering mental health issues. I was only on the call with the GP at the surgery's request, not because I felt ill and the GP's first question was -So when do you think this anxiety and stress will end? and they could not wait to get me off the phone.  
Quite frankly I was stunned and if I wished I had taken greater issue with their comment on the call. They simply issued prescriptions for my pill and beta blockers and told me to come back in 4 weeks. When I questioned whether I should be on the pill aged 49 or not (having raised this on at least one occasion last year and being fobbed off), I was told I really should not be on the pill I am but another 2 months would be alright and to come back to them on it after that. Having not been seen or been able to discuss the issues with a GP who was not in a rush to get me off the phone, I feel I have no choice but to seek a private consultation.

links.id: afraid i am not on the right medication

author: Menkf73
title: Chasing a Referral
body:
Hi just wondering how long does it take once a referral is made? Mental health is getting severe, very high risk at home, don‚Äôt feel safe.  
Crisis team made a referral and just wondering how long it take for them to pick it up and what are the next steps once accepting the referral or declining the referral.  
Thank you

readBy.name: Turning Point (Haven House and Beacon Lodge)

author: MS1950
title: Lacking patient care during night shift
body:
Before I relate my concerns I wish to make it clear that I appreciate the extreme conditions doctors, nurses and all staff are working under within the NHS and also wish to state that for the most part their professionalism and efficiency are clearly seen.  
Last week my husband was admitted to Ulster Hospital and one night quite late he had reason to buzz the night staff - of which there were only two. He had been catheterised and this particular night fluid was not passing through to leg bag and pressure was building in his bladder. The nurse came into his room and realised they couldn‚Äôt offer him any help - as they explained they had an injury, but said they would go and get help and left the room. Meantime fluid was leaking from either side of catheter And the bed became wet as well as my husbands nightwear.  
Eventually someone else came in and my husband explained what was happening. This person (why I say person - my husband didn‚Äôt think this staff member was a nurse) but this person decided the answer was to fit a night bag to the leg bag. My husband assured him this would not work as problem appeared to be at catheter site and if it couldn‚Äôt drain into leg bag it definitely wouldn‚Äôt get to night bag. The staff member ignored my husband - who was becoming increasingly more distressed- and insisted this would work. My husband explained he was already lying wet and his whole situation would only get worse because this staff member was not tackling the problem and meanwhile the pressure was building and my husband was in pain. The member of staff said they would then have to get a doctor and my husband asked ‚Äúnow? The staff member said no in the morning. My husband explained he definitely couldn‚Äôt wait that long to which they replied well what am I supposed to do? and left my husband wet and in pain.  
These are the only two people on duty and it is fair to say one physically couldn‚Äôt help and the other hadn‚Äôt a clue and/or didn‚Äôt care less.  
There is a duty of care to patients which was most certainly lacking that night. The very worrying concern is potentially patients lives were put at risk that night.  
Our Government should be absolutely ashamed they have not carried out their promises to NHS. I understand if staff strike it is potentially putting patients lives at risk but believe me it is only when you see the struggle of the staff first hand, patients in hospital are potentially more at risk than one or two days of an all out strike.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Brilliant Care
body: All the staff at the practice have been brilliant with me contacting the surgery recently with my care quite a number of times as I have been quite unwell, always feel like I've been dealt with properly. If I've needed to come in a GP has seen me if appropriate after speaking to them over the phone.

title: Unbelievable Staff
body: I visited the dental hospital on 18/03/3022 in absolute agony, initially I was told no walk-in appointments. However, due to being visibly distressed they were kind enough to "fit" me in. After nearly 3 hours the problem tooth was successfully extracted. Like most people I have a fear of the dentist, however, the staff - every single one of them - put me at ease, and made feel assured that everything was OK. I know the surgery didn't go to plan, but in the end it's done now, and I'm pain free. Many, many thanks x L Doherty

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: warm hearted staff
body: I attended Gynae Oncology on 4 Feb 2022. I was very much in two minds about going ahead and exhausted. The nurse related to me as an individual rather than viewing me as just another patient. I managed to bang my head and she wanted to know how I managed that. The Consultant was patient and fabulous in attitude despite her busy schedule. Can't ask for more really.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Eye Doctors, not available
body: Treated at ES, Crawley and Horsham, for macular degeneration, but haven‚Äôt seen an eye doctor for many months, appointments and even phone appointments often cancelled, my eyes deteriorating and desperately need examination by specialist, but cannot get apointment.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Dishonest staff
body: This used to be a good practice but sadly it has gone down hill rapidly. I phoned the practice for some information and was told I had to go in person to deal with the situation, the next day I was told that the particular service I requested could only be done online and then denied telling me different information over the phone, a couple of the receptionists are rude and unhelpful and make great whole experience unpleasant.  The practice Manager is lovely though.

title: Excellent treatment
body: Thank you for the excellent treatment my husband recieved in casualty (9.3.22) but the 7 hour wait was traumatic for his 86 years. The quality of the surgery was excellent.

title: Excellent service
body:
The staff at The Birches are amazing. They are kind and put you at ease.
The telephone is answered promptly and I can always get an appointment if needed.


Thank you so much for your continued hard work and dedication to the patients during these difficult times.

title: Non patients centered service
body: Trying to get through to reception start ringing from 8am & through out the day is just redclious. And when you eventually get to speak to someone all calls to Dr are gone,  i attended to surgery with severe pains the Dr said she can't help. I surgested a scan she still say i still leaving with my problem on solve at present the Practice is not providing a service

author: GraceN
title: Lovely and reassuring at the breast prothesis service
body:
I was nervous about being fitted for a breast prothesis and didn‚Äôt expect much from the appointment.  
On the contrary, I was met by a nurse called Elaine who immediately put me at ease and expertly fitted me with a bra and prothesis that made me look back to my normal self.  
Following my single mastectomy I had been wearing baggie clothes and ignoring most of my wardrobe. Following this I now feel ‚Äònormal‚Äô again and able to wear whatever I want. Elaine was just so lovely and reassuring and I came away feeling so much better.  
Very grateful for this amazing service.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

title: WORST PRACTICE
body: This practice is the worst surgery i have registered with. They are never busy yet it takes forever to get through to them on the phone. If you get booked for an appointment, chances are ,you might be recorded a wrong time on there computer and then sent a wrong appointment as text to your phone. They are so backward that they will never send an appointment reminder just in case you where to forget your appointment with them. Everytime I go there , there is one mix up or the other. All you keep hearing is I am sorry there there was a mix up somewhere. Not a good practice to register with. Its so cold and dead .

author: Gem79
title: Testing procedure for visitors feels counter-productive
body:
The visiting process at this hospital makes no sense and just makes and an already anxious family of a patient more stressed.  
My dad was admitted to Tameside having suffered a stroke. This was obviously extremely distressing for both him and his family. I do understand that we may still have to have some restrictions when allowing visitors due to COVID but the procedures they have in place here feel counter-productive.  
Having visitors held in the entrance hall to perform LFT tests prior to visiting seems wrong. Surely the sensible thing to do is for the visitor to test before you leave home... if a person was to test positive in this area you have potentially just infected the other people waiting there too?  
You have a central phone number to book the appointment which is busy and sometimes doesn‚Äôt get answered for a while. Going from one central place to book in for your appointment to then have to walk across the hospital site to the ward you are visiting is encouraging people moving around the hospital unnecessarily.  
I know other hospitals do not have this procedure for visitors. Booking an appointment directly with the ward, encouraging LFT before going to the hospital and wearing masks whilst visiting feel like appropriate measures and ones that have been adopted in other trusts.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very reassuring
body: One of the paramedics came out to visit an elderly lady who suffers from dementia. She was very kind and explained what the problem was calmly and fully. The lady's daughter was very worried and was very reassured by the time everything had been explained.

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

author: sagittariusrc84
title: Lovely nurse kept me calm
body:
I was really nervous about the procedure but the nurse that was removing and replacing my implant was lovely. She kept me calm throughout and talking to me to distract me as much as she could.  
Thank you.

title: Some poor manners
body: I wasn't happy with some of the night nurses' attitudes. I didn't agree with how I was treated and how my father was treated. Hopefully next time we visit, it will be better.

title: CT Scan Team
body: Just wanted to say a huge thank you to the staff who had volunteered to work today, Sunday, in the CT scanning department in order to help clear the back log caused by Covid. Professional and efficient service which was much appreciated.

title: Very slow service
body:
I am a doctor at this hospital and I can say that do not come to this hospital please. I have been here twice with problems for which I would see the patient sooner rather than later. I was brought in by ambulance at 2:30 am with palpitations and shortness of breath but I wasn‚Äôt seen until 5:40 am now. I have reported palpitations multiple times to the nursing staff. They keep doing Ecg‚Äôs. That‚Äôs it. 
 The waiting room is not busy at all for this hospital today. 
When the paramedics asked me which ED to go to, I should have chosen elsewhere.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great A&E service
body: Took my son to A&E yesterday evening for his croup. We were seen rapidly and all staff were very friendly and our experience was extremely positive

author: Killiegirl
title: Lack of pain relief despite previous labour history
body:
After a horrendous first labour in 2015 where I was left to labour alone in the antenatal ward with no care or support and told I wasn‚Äôt in labour by the midwife (my waters had went at 34 weeks pregnant) I suffered PND and PTSD triggered by my second pregnancy in 2021.  
I was under the perinatal mental health midwife care this time (who was fantastic), however suffered extreme anxiety about another premature baby.  
Thankfully I went into labour at 37 weeks. My waters broke again and I was admitted to the ward at Ninewells due to gestational diabetes and previous precipitate labour. With my first I had no pain relief because of the care and speed of my labour, apart from gas & air in the labour suite. I was adamant I wanted pain relief this time and surely I‚Äôd be able to get it as they had prior warning of my fast labour?  
Apparently not, as my baby decided he was coming at shift handover time. I laboured on the ward (again) in extreme agony (back to back) asking to go down to labour suite and was told I had to wait for shift handover. I got gas & air in the ward which did nothing for me. My labour was fast again, I was rushed to labour suite on a bed (again) told I was fully dilated and had no pain relief.  
Two poor experiences of birth at Ninewells. The first had a profound negative effect on my mental health which I‚Äôm still suffering with 6 years on. Luckily this time the perinatal care helped me and I don‚Äôt have PND after the birth of my second child.  
They must do better. Babies do not wait for shift changeover.

author: AnnieG01
title: Care in her own surroundings
body:
Been going to GP for while looking for revaluation of meds etc , which had not happened, then mum took not well, GP gave 2 courses antibiotics and steroids, which never worked.Wow i can't say anything else other than,, angels appeared in the form of hospital at home , the first day possibly 1 hour or less apart I had a nurse then sister kerry, mum didnt want to worry me so been hiding aches etc including lump on neck, but the exam that she received that day, well i worked in a hospital for 10 yrs , and these hospital home angels deserve medals, professional, compassionate, understanding, and so good with her. I've only met some of these nurses, they have done full medical xrays ct scans bloods regular bladder scans, changed meds the works, mum feels so much more settled mentally and absolutely adores them  
I think this service is valuable to nhs, and I also think it would be good to put some information out there to allow people to know about this service. My mum doesn't want to go into hospital so this is an amazing service, helps her not suffer yet still in her own surroundings, I'd like to thank personally Dr and staff who been involved in mums care  
Dr Polk, Sister Kerry, Jennifer, Crystal, Nathan and Martin support worker

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: indusgg9
title: Limited hours and condescending phone manner
body:
I looked on the website for clinic hours, having to get my mother to call for an appointment due to the poor phone hours, to be told I needed a phone appointment for pill renewals.  
When I took this call however, the person at the end of the phone was condescending and rude when they told me I needed a face to face appointment. I was told the clinic isn‚Äôt open past 4pm, which according to the website is 6pm.  
I work until 4, and so can‚Äôt make that appointment to which I was told: ‚ÄúJust take some leave from your job‚Äù to attend an appointment. And when I questioned the 6pm closing time was told that there was a ‚Äúpesky thing called a pandemic‚Äù that disrupted hours, in a rude and condescending tone.  
I was then told to go to a pharmacy to have my blood pressure, height and weight taken but that I‚Äôd ‚Äúbetter go off and do some research‚Äù so I wasn‚Äôt charged at the pharmacy.  
I now need to go to the pharmacy, get my mum to call back to make another phone appointment, to wait for that call, and give the information over, then wait for pills to be posted.  
There was no need for the rude manner in which I was spoken to, being made to feel guilty for working and needing later appointments.

title: Hopeless
body:
My experience over the last few years here has been pretty awful. It‚Äôs frustrating as I only live a few mins away.
If you phone them for an appt you are always on hold for an hour or more, knowing that just puts me off to begin with, it‚Äôs like I have to take a day off work to be able to have the time to make the phone call as I can‚Äôt just take an hour off while at work.
When i have actually gotten through and spoken to a receptionist, I have to tell them exactly why I need to see a doctor (there‚Äôs no privacy anymore) and when I do get offered a telephone appt it‚Äôs a month away!
Then when I accepted that appt, because it was that or nothing, it got cancelled two days before it was due and I was offered another appt two weeks later that I couldn‚Äôt make so I ended up getting another appt six weeks later.
When I am offered a telephone appt I am not able to get a time I want it‚Äôs just what is available, that‚Äôs also frustrating as when the appt is a month in the future all times should be available.
I currently have three non urgent reasons to see the doctor, it‚Äôs on my medical record to contact the surgery, but the thought of phoning the practice again just makes me want to lose the will to live.
Why can‚Äôt you employ another receptionist or two?
Surely things have to change, you must be aware how hard it is to get appts, not all surgeries are as hard to get appts

author: Sundance30
title: I understand resources are short but I am very disappointed
body:
My mother had surgery for cancer (hysterectomy) and received excellent service on ward 54 at Victoria hospital, Kirkcaldy.  
After a couple of nights she was moved to the surgical short stay unit and had a dreadful experience. She agreed to move as she knew someone else needed the bed on ward 54 but would not have agreed to move had she known what it would be like.  
She said she had to wait for hours before someone came to move her. She also said the ward was noisy all night with lights on, music playing and people coming and going. This was very stressful for her and she was confused and frightened.  
I was called early in the morning to come and get her. The charge nurse I spoke to when I arrived was very helpful and apologised and said they would look into it, as they weren't there overnight.  
I understand that resources are short but I am very disappointed that my mum had this experience.

author: blackbirdnn64
title: Praise for my husband's care at home
body:
I just wanted to give praise where praise is due. The care package we have for my husband is wonderful and we are absolutely happy with it.  
He had a stroke and was in hospital where he then caught Covid. He was isolated in a small ward on his own which devastated him, not allowed visits affected his mental health extremely and against advice as soon as he had finished isolating, we brought him home.  
There was no care package in place, but we needed him home for his own wellbeing, he needed to be with his family. The trust however went the extra mile, and we received a phone call that evening to say a care plan had been organised.  
This is our first experience of having carers and we were apprehensive, but we couldn‚Äôt have asked for a nicer team of girls, they are all so lovely and organised the equipment my husband needed. With their help he his making progress and we are very very grateful.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Boozyuser
title: Drinking too much
body:
After having a dull ache in my left side for several weeks I eventually decided to see my doctor about it in the hope it wasn't something serious and was stress related as I have had before linked to the death of my wife.  
Fortunately all the tests proved negative but the doctor had asked me about my alcohol consumption which had steadily risen throughout Lockdown/Covid to dangerous levels. She suggested CGL would be a helpful service for me, so I agreed to the referral.  
Whilst I feel I'm not in as much trouble as some of the other attendees of the workshop, it has taught me a lot about where alcohol can lead, and my experiences here have illustrated to me how important it is for people to be able to access services like the CGL workshops and counseling.

author: gruswm54
title: Told that I should seek a private diagnosis
body: I had an appointment with my GP today, and I wanted to discuss my mental health and the diagnosis of potential ADHD and anxiety issues. I have been facing these issues for quite some time. My university Disabilities Adviser and Postgraduate Wellbeing Adviser suggested that I have symptoms of ADHD and anxiety. I am worried about this, and this is really affecting my studies, daily activities, and mental health. I asked my GP to refer me for my mental health diagnosis, and he responded that I should go for a private diagnosis. Being an international student, I can't afford a private diagnosis.

readBy.name: Office of Joe Fitzpatrick, MSP for Dundee City West

author: corridortj35
title: Post covid zoom meeting
body: Attended an online clinic through zoom for post covid and long covid two weeks ago. I attended a previous one which wasn‚Äôt very good and they didn‚Äôt seem to know what they were doing. This one though was presented perfectly well. The lady who spoke to us, Lorraine, was lovely and very professional and knew what she was talking about. The doctor, John Dalan, made everything very clear. The whole session was informative, professional and useful. They did follow ups after the session and my own GP contacted for follow up and further treatment should I require them. Very happy I attend the meeting.

author: GillyNUFC
title: Sleep service
body:
Just wanted to say that the service I received at Mr Oko's sleep clinic was brilliant and I really love the telephone consultations.  
Nurse Shamina as usual was kind , supportive and professional and ensured that I had what I required and was happy before the conversation ended.  
Thank you again

author: leohy78
title: Clinic appointment
body: Saturday appointment, tests and bloods. Seen on time by polite staff, my concernes were listened to and a treatment plan agreed.

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have all been excellent
body: I arrived here last Saturday via ambulance that I waited on for 3 hours, and ended up staying in it for an additional 5 hours. As the days have went on I am finding myself getting more and more comfortable in my surroundings. The staff have all been excellent, but due to the fact there is so many, I have been unable to build a strong bond or relationship with any of them, something I do feel would make me much more comfortable. Despite this I can‚Äôt say a bad word about any of the staff, they‚Äôve all been wonderful and caring. The general cleanliness of the ward is spot on and the food is also great with a wide variety of options for each meal. Overall most things have been of a great standard.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Fmcgr21
title: Inpatient stay for my son
body:
As a mother of a 31 yr old son with mild learning difficulties , trying to get information from staff in ED was terrible.  
Once we were transferred to ward 7b the care could not have been better and the staff have been wonderful. Felt genuinely cared for and my son put at ease.  
Kept informed at all times and staff couldn‚Äôt do enough to help us both. Has really boosted my opinion of the NHS after a difficult start in ED

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Samiie93
title: Lovely play therapist put my daughter at ease
body:
My daughter who is 4 came to have a short stay on the medical ward in Aberdeen Children's Hospital and required the help from a play therapist.  
Upon arrival we were greeted by Sarah, a lovely bubbly lady who came to play with my daughter. She helped my daughter stay calm when drs and nurses came to do observations and examinations. She made taking medication fun and listened to her and how she was feeling!  
Without Sarah I don‚Äôt think we would have coped or been successful as we have with my daughter's stay. She is going through a diagnosis for autism and other investigations but Sarah put her mind right at ease and I as a parent felt less stressed about the stay on the ward.  
Sarah has also given my daughter new ideas of crafts and fun sensory play to continue at home to help with her medication intake. Sarah is super calm and so happy and clearly enjoys her job with these children!

author: eagleje66
title: Concerned about my treatment at Assisted Conception Service
body:
I was a patient at ACS from 2017-2019. During this time I underwent 4 x IVFs. I was in my early forties with reasonable AMH and no fertility issues other than age. I had a previous pregnancy a few years earlier with no issues. I was undergoing fertility treatment due to male factor infertility issues.  
I feel that the treatment I received as a patient was not individualised at ACS at all. I was put on a treatment protocol for females with low AMH; prescribed the highest dose of fertility meds at a high cost physically/mentally/financially.  
During IVF treatment I felt that I was not coping with the high dose of ovarian stimulation meds physically and mentally (Abdo pain / night sweats / headaches / mood swings) and often explained to the nurse that it seemed that it was too much ovulation stimulation and should be reduced. I was always told that because of my age I should be on max dose of fertility stimulation drugs and this would give me the best chance of success.  
I feel that ACS pushed me to have maximum drugs to try and get an increased quantity of eggs harvested. I feel my concerns that I was on too much medication were not listened to and that I was just a number. I do not feel that the treatment was personalised in any way. I enquired about reducing the fertility meds and opting for a more natural cycle however I was advised that this would reduce any chance of pregnancy.  
After 4 failed cycles at ACS and not being listened to I changed to another private clinic. The doctor at the new clinic agreed that I had been put on far too high a dose of ovarian stimulation meds and agreed that this would really not have been good for my body and would likely have impacted negatively on egg quality. At the new clinic I had another two cycles using less than half the amount of ovarian stimulation meds which yielded similar amounts of eggs. It was a breeze at the new clinic in comparison to the treatment at Glasgow ACS.  
Unfortunately I did not get pregnant at the new clinic however I wish I had not wasted 2 years in my early forties doing IVF at ACS. I feel I was over -medicated with ovarian stimulation and the treatment protocol was not personalised. In my experience ACS do not personalise treatment and push maximum ovarian stimulation in an attempt to try and get as much eggs as possible. This is a trying process mentally and physically and one which requires scrutiny.  
I also had a lot of issues with the administration side of things around consents and blood tests etc. There was always some issue. As well as that I found ACS very inflexible re appointment times.  
I wanted to record my concerns publicly about ACS as it would be interesting to establish whether other females have had similar issues concerning being over-medicated with ovarian stimulation and this impacting on them negatively.

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have all been lovely
body: I came to Craigavon Hospital 8 days ago with a fractured foot. I rang an ambulance and waited 10 hours before I took it upon myself to phone one of my relatives to bring me to hospital, I then waited another while in Daisy Hill hospital before being transported to Craigavon via ambulance. Since I have been here I have been very comfortable with everything, my room, staff, and bed. The staff have all been lovely to me and I feel like I can approach them at any time with any problems I may have. I appreciate that they are always busy but always seem to find the time for everyone, not just me. The food has been lovely, with a wide variety, all of which seems to be great. The ward and facilities is spotless with cleaners working very hard to keep the ward safe.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Unhsr66
title: Terrible treatment by receptionist
body: My son has just spent 6 weeks in hospital 4 weeks on a ventilator in ICU with a brain injury. He left the hospital with a lot of medication to take. This is the first prescription he needed and found 1 medication was not on the prescription so with a lot of effort made a visit to the doctors surgery to explain the mistake and ask for help. The receptionist was actually very helpful and said they would sort it and he could collect the medication the next day. The next day he was not very well so I went to collect the medication. The missing tablets were still not on the prescription so I went back to the reception. The first person I saw said the doctor had not ticked a box we all make mistakes nobody is perfect but then another staff member interrupted who was so unhelpful rude and showed no empathy, just kept repeating it was my sons fault, and that 48 hours were needed for medication. They did not ask any questions or try to help and the tone of voice was very condescending. I left in tears and really feel disappointed with my experience, this has been my doctors for many years.

author: Aquarius21x
title: My knee
body: The staff member did checks and gave me exercises to do to help my knee. I felt good

author: aprildt35
title: The perfect care given to my dad
body: I took my dad to minor injuries after he had a fall (my dad has dementia so I was allowed in with him) the student nurse Chienese and Staff nurse Paul treated my dad with the greatest of respect and kindness which was very much noticed by my dad who said on leaving I think they gave me the works in there, lovely people. They explained everything to myself and my dad very much appreciated. Thank you.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

author: CBH
title: Blood test
body: Had a blood test & it was fine.

author: leopardff54
title: Understaffed
body: Had an appointment but was seen late. I feel that they are understaffed, poor service

author: vbarclay5782
title: Urogynaecology clinic appointment
body:
My gran attended the Urogynaecology Clinic at the New Victoria Hospital. The experience we received was excellent and very personable. Karen, Hayley and Iga took great care of my gran and treated her with the highest respect and dignity.  
Thank you for your kindness.

author: Ell88
title: Not assessed by psychiatry after nearly 3 weeks
body:
My much loved relative is here having tried to take his own life nearly 3 weeks ago, very nearly succeeding. He remains unwell but has stabilised.  
I am horrified to report that he has not been assessed by psychiatry. He is not known to psychiatry previously and I could consider him at high risk to reattempt. They have not addressed his risk of an attempt on the ward. I believe that this is unacceptable practice.  
Despite repeatedly asking to speak to the medical team I‚Äôve had no luck as they are too busy. I‚Äôve left my number and received no call.  
Now the hospital has suspended visits. I think I might still be able to see him on mental health grounds but cannot clarify as it appears the hospital has taken the decision to block external incoming calls, leaving us completely helpless to try and advocate for him further.  
I cannot describe how upset we are as a family tonight. We are increasingly worried about his safety and support in the hospital where he is meant to be safe.  
My removing visiting and blocking any contact to the medical staff they have removed our ability to help and support him.

author: spring22
title: Discharged in the early hours of the morning
body: My mum, who is in her 80's, was admitted to A and E after a fall. She has osteoporosis and has just recovered from an acute episode of ill health which required hospital admission. She fell on her shoulder and had pain in her chest and arm. Her overriding anxiety was she had broken something. She arrived by ambulance in the evening. I phoned 3 hours after her arrival - dept very busy she was waiting to be seen. I phoned again in the early hours of the morning, Dr told me she was about to be assessed. Phoned an hour later - another Dr told me she was oxygen dependent, bloods had been taken, plan of action to be confirmed but she would be handed to the medical team and admitted. In the meantime My mum had phoned my brother saying she was being discharged. He picked her up from a reception area where she was sitting alone, no information provided other than a prescription for antibiotics. I realise the system is under pressure but to leave an exhausted elderly person unattended in an empty waiting room to make the call asking for a lift home at 4am after admission with a fall is not acceptable. She is self-caring, independent normally - but cannot remember as she is so tired what happened and what was said - and is in a lot of pain this morning. As family members we need information to continue care at home so as not to have to constantly refer to an overstretched system. What bloods were done? She was anaemic last week‚Ä¶ cause still to be determined. Was she x rayed? Could she have a rib or vertebra fracture? This information is crucial to our ongoing care and re mobilization at home.

author: Chatham resident
title: Queuing outside before visiting
body:
This is a follow up to my previous story about my wife being made to wait outside A&E at 4am in the morning whilst her mother with mixed dementia was taken in alone.  
Her mother was later admitted to the hospital and the next day when my wife went to visit on a booked visiting slot, she and many others were made to queue outside in the rain and despite protesting and asking if they could go inside to get warm and get a cuppa in the cafe they were told in an abrupt and unfriendly manner by one of the women directing the queue that no they could not and they wouldn't be allowed in until they said so! They only started letting visitors in 5 minutes before the scheduled visit and the ward my wife was visiting was over the other side of the hospital, so no time to stop at the shop before her visit with her mother.  
I saw a reply over two weeks ago to another person saying it was being reviewed so that visitors would no longer have to queue outside - however 2 weeks later and it's still happening, if people are wearing masks and using antibac why do they have to wait outside?

author: asteropexz39
title: Empathetic and understanding staff
body:
The Endoscopy department were all so kind and caring, putting me at ease about my Flexible Sigmoidoscopy treatment at the Gemini Endoscopy Suite, North Devon Hospital in Barnstaple, Devon.  
My initial telephone appointment was with the Specialist Karen who was so empathetic and understanding, clearly explaining the whole procedure after investigating all my symptoms. Then I had another telephone appointment another day with the Pre-Assessment Nurse Maggie who was also really helpful and answered all my queries, a super lady as was Karen.  
On the day of my procedure, the whole team of Dr Davis, Sue, Caro, Nikki, Caroline and all the other nurses were absolutely wonderful and I can't praise them enough for all their excellent care.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Best GP
body:
Grantham Practice is the best surgery I have ever been registered with
They are open for face to face appointments, really quick to make referrals  when needed and my prescription requests are usually processed within 24-48 hrs

title: Excellent service
body: Needed treatment for an accident to my eye on a Sunday night. I rang the emergency number and was asked how long it would take me to get there and given an appointment to attend at that time. On arrival seen straight away by the nurse and the offending object removed. A few minutes later the eye was checked by a doctor. This was an absolutely fantastic service please keep it up. Thank you very much.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding 5* treatment care and responsiveness
body: Fantastic well run department attention to cleanliness second to none. Nurses responsive to needs at all time and unwaveringly monitoring and caring. Doctors and consultants engage fully with patients to whom they give a voice and treat with respect at all times difficult patients treated calmly and quietly in a loving and understanding way.  Overall so proud of the people who work on this ward and the unstinting time and care dispensed. Thank you thank you.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body: I have only good things to say about this GP surgery. I have every faith in the experience of their doctors. I can get advice and be seen very quickly. The nurses have a great manner with my children when doing their vaccinations. The reception staff are kind and efficient. Recently my child was diagnosed with an illness which needed a bit more time and investigation. The doctors were thorough, efficient and so kind. I recommend this practice very highly.

title: Friendly service
body: Very friendly, polite, caring and helpful staff who listens and gives professional advice. I am very pleased and satisfied with the service I received and would be very pleased to recommend this service to my friends.

title: Responsive receptionist at practice
body: I had a delay in receiving medication via the NHS app. Went into practice and explained circumstances to receptionist. He was very helpful and assured me the meds would be sorted within the day. I am pleased to say they were sorted out via the GP practice and pharmacy within a couple of hours. Very polite, courteous and efficient gentleman dealt with this on reception.

title: Good service
body: Had a good experience when we went to link our medical records very friendly and helpful would always recommend this practice

title: Expert care
body: Having been fast tracked for my operation I was treated with respect and dignity by all the staff who saw me. Several nurses went a above and beyond to make me comfortable.I was vomiting one night and a lovely nurse held my hand and reassured me. Cleaning folk did a great job on ward 56. Would have loved some soda water. Why do some wards have ice and not others?

title: Wellbeing
body:
It's three weeks since my first eye operation.
Next week I go to my optician for a review,
Spa Medica Deansgate were wonderful, everything was smooth and efficient, all was explained at every stage.
I was amazed at the improvement in my sight.
I can't wait for my second operation.

title: Absolutely marvellous treatment
body:
The Doctors, nurses and auxiliary staff are wonderful and friendly, nothing is too much trouble and they can't do enough to help. They are very supportive and professional, would recommend them to anyone.
I like New Cross as well, I suppose because Cannock hospital is not so large the service seems more personal. Thank you for the experience
